intro: Lastrea subincisa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, exhibiting a low, spreading growth habit. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually yellow or orange, adding ornamental value to its appearance. Due to its adaptability and drought tolerance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
